item.title: 1 - Steps
item.description:
Introduction To Steps #

Next

Steps are the basic building block for jobs. These are the actual actions part of GitHub Actions. They are essentially a task that you need done. This could be a task that uses code in the repository, but it does not have to be. A step could essentially do anything.

Think of steps as analogous to functions in code. They are a logical grouping of behaviors.

item.title: 2 - Jobs
item.description:
Introduction To Jobs #

Next

In GitHub Actions, jobs represent a series of steps that are executed in order. Important things to know about jobs:

  • Jobs must run on a single runner
  • Jobs have a workspace which persists between steps
  • Jobs can trigger other jobs
  • Jobs must be defined inside a workflow

item.title: 3 - Workflows
item.description:
Introduction To Workflows #

Next

In GitHub Actions, workflows are a colleciton of jobs. Important things to know about workflows

  • Workflows can define multiple jobs
  • Workflows can be called many ways:
    • By code change
    • Manually
    • By other workflows
  • Workflows do not actually execute directly, they only define jobs which get executed
